docs.lead_paragraph: This year’s economic forecasts from the Congressional Budget Office were worse than last year’s because the office stopped treating the recent slow years as outliers.

headline.main: A Dire Economic Forecast Based on New Assumptions
headline.print_headline: A Dire Economic Forecast Based on New Assumptions

docs.abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column takes issue with the Congressional Budget Office's decision to stop treating recent years of slow economic performance as outliers while making its annual growth forecast; expresses doubt that economy will be as sluggish, or that interests rates will be as high as the CBO predicts, noting that grim 2014 forecast could have a pernicious effect on congressional debate and action.
docs.snippet: This year’s economic forecasts from the Congressional Budget Office were worse than last year’s because the office stopped treating the recent slow years as outliers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The announcement by Mayor Vincent C. Gray reiterates that gender dysphoria — a diagnosis for psychological discomfort with one’s sex — is a recognized medical condition.

headline.main: D.C. Insurance Must Cover Treatment for Transgender Residents, Mayor Says

docs.snippet: The announcement by Mayor Vincent C. Gray reiterates that gender dysphoria — a diagnosis for psychological discomfort with one’s sex — is a recognized medical condition.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration quietly issued a health law fix Thursday to help states that have had technical problems running their own enrollment websites. It could stir up critics but may help the law's supporters.

headline.main: Health Law Fix for State-Run Websites
headline.print_headline: Health Law Fix for State-Run Websites

docs.snippet: The Obama administration quietly issued a health law fix Thursday to help states that have had technical problems running their own enrollment websites. It could stir up critics but may help the law's supporters.

docs.lead_paragraph: The largest group in the conservative U.S. Tea Party movement celebrated its fifth anniversary on Thursday with a pledge to push Congress further to the right and capture the White House in 2016.

headline.main: On Anniversary, Tea Party Vows to Move U.S. Congress to Right
headline.print_headline: On Anniversary, Tea Party Vows to Move U.S. Congress to Right

docs.snippet: The largest group in the conservative U.S. Tea Party movement celebrated its fifth anniversary on Thursday with a pledge to push Congress further to the right and capture the White House in 2016.

docs.lead_paragraph: Utah's Republican governor announced Thursday he wants to reject a full Medicaid expansion that would enroll more people in the government program, and instead seek federal dollars to cover the poor in private plans.

headline.main: Utah Governor Rejects Full Medicaid Expansion
headline.print_headline: Utah Governor Rejects Full Medicaid Expansion

docs.snippet: Utah's Republican governor announced Thursday he wants to reject a full Medicaid expansion that would enroll more people in the government program, and instead seek federal dollars to cover the poor in private plans.

headline.main: Study Indicates That Bill Redefining Full-Time Employment Would Have Costs

docs.abstract: The Save American Workers Act would move the definition of full-time employment to 40 hours and require businesses to provide health insurance to fewer workers.
docs.snippet: The Save American Workers Act would move the definition of full-time employment to 40 hours and require businesses to provide health insurance to fewer workers.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama will ask Congress to approve spending more than $5 billion on medical training to turn out some 13,000 primary care providers over the next 10 years.

headline.main: Obama Seeks More Federal Spending to Train Doctors
headline.print_headline: Obama Seeks More Federal Spending to Train Doctors

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama will ask Congress to approve spending more than $5 billion on medical training to turn out some 13,000 primary care providers over the next 10 years.

docs.lead_paragraph: Colorado's Senate race has been roiled by the last-minute entry of rising GOP star Rep. Cory Gardner, a move that increases pressure on both Democratic incumbent Mark Udall and his party as it struggles to maintain control of the Senate.

headline.main: Gardner In and Buck Out in Colorado's Senate Race
headline.print_headline: Gardner In and Buck Out in Colorado's Senate Race

docs.snippet: Colorado's Senate race has been roiled by the last-minute entry of rising GOP star Rep. Cory Gardner, a move that increases pressure on both Democratic incumbent Mark Udall and his party as it struggles to maintain control of the Senate.

docs.lead_paragraph: Europe's largest insurer Allianz expects problems at bond fund manager Pimco to weigh on group performance in 2014 after investors withdrew money last year and Pimco chief executive Mohamed El-Erian said he would leave.

headline.main: Pimco Worries Takes Shine Off Allianz Earnings
headline.print_headline: Pimco Worries Takes Shine Off Allianz Earnings

docs.snippet: Europe's largest insurer Allianz expects problems at bond fund manager Pimco to weigh on group performance in 2014 after investors withdrew money last year and Pimco chief executive Mohamed El-Erian said he would leave.
